As we watch the news we hear about the changes in state testing. This year is being described as a "total reset."
"What families need to expect is that scores are going to go down," State Superintendent, Joy Hofmeister said. "Its going to be a jolt. Its going to surprise people."
Why did the tests change? Why did the cut scores change? Oklahoma raised the cut scores and the complexity of the test to be comparable to national scores and test complexity. There will be no comparison possible to any prior years scores. The video below explains the process of the change and expectations going forward for all Oklahoma students.
We are going to do our best to prepare students at Locust Grove to meet the new challenge head on. We will be discussing the possibilities of the new tests Monday night at Parent/Teacher Conferences. We will also be giving out a Frequently Asked Questions information sheet.

Please remember to come to Parent/Teacher conferences Monday October 16th from 1p.m. to 7p.m.
We want to celebrate your student with you!

There will be no comparison possible to any prior years scores. The video below explains the process of the change and expectations going forward for all Oklahoma students.
We are going to do our best to prepare students at Locust Grove to meet the new challenge head on. We will be discussing the possibilities of the new tests Monday night at Parent/Teacher Conferences. We will also be giving out a Frequently Asked Questions information sheet.

Please remember to come to Parent/Teacher conferences Monday October 16th from 1p.m. to 7p.m.
We want to celebrate your student with you!

Due to an incident this morning Mayes County deputies will increase patrols along our bus routes as a precaution and to gather more information. The Sheriff's Office stressed that they have no reason to believe a crime was committed.
Mayes County Sheriff Captain Rod Howell says an 8-year-old was waiting for her bus when her parent saw a white minivan pull up to where the child was standing and a side door opened. He says the girl's parent shouted and the van left. Howell indicated that it's possible the driver may have just been checking on the child.
The safety and security of our students is always our foremost concern. Teachers will be talking with students about safety; please use this opportunity to remind your children about stranger danger as well.
